task.title: Extending an XML catalog file
task.shortdesc: You can update either the main DITA-OT XML catalog or the XML catalog that is used by the PDF plug-in. This enables the DITA-OT to support new specializations and document-type shells.

context.p: You can use the dita.specialization.catalog.relative and org.dita.pdf2.catalog.relative extension points to update the DITA-OT catalog files.
context.note: The dita.specialization.catalog extension is deprecated. Use dita.specialization.catalog.relative instead.

step.cmd: Using the OASIS catalog format, create an XML catalog file that contains only the new values that you want to add to a DITA-OT catalog file.
Create a plug-in.xml file that contains the following content:
step.info:
<plugin id="plugin-id"> <feature extension="extension-point" file="file"/> </plugin>where:
plugin-id is the plug-in identifier, for example, com.example.catalog.
extension-point is either dita.specialization.catalog.relative or org.dita.pdf2.catalog.relative.
file is the name of the new catalog file, for example, catalog-dita.xml.

step.cmd: Save the new XML catalog file to your plug-in. Be sure that the local file references are relative to the location of the catalog and plug-in.

taskbody.result: The catalog entries inside of the new catalog file are added to the core DITA-OT catalog file.

example.title: Example
example.p: This example assumes that catalog-dita.xml contains an OASIS catalog for any document-type shells inside this plug-in. The catalog entries in catalog-dita.xml are relative to the catalog itself; when the plug-in is installed, they are added to the core DITA-OT catalog (with the correct path).
